text:
Fulton Street, from Columbia Heights to Court Street, showing at the right the American Hotel, No. 28, and the "Brooklyn Daily Union", No. 31. Also a general view south east from one of the towers of the Brooklyn Bridge- then under construction.

About 1872.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Columbia Heights

text:
Court Street, south from Myrtle Ave. In the foreground, is Myrtle Ave. At the left background, is Borough Hall and the Park. In front of the park running right and left, is Fulton Street, upon which is now an elevated line.

1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) At the intersection of Court and Fulton Streets, showing Brooklyn City Hall (now Borough Hall) and the park. At the left (building with the dome) is the court house on Joralemon Street.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing also the S.W. corner of Myrtle Ave., situated thereon is the Oyster House of Phil. H. Grogan.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, a northerly view, showing Fulton Street at the right. The Brooklyn Safe Deposit Co., is visible at right. The buildings in the triangle (background) still standing in (1929).

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing Fulton Street more fully, prior to the erection of the Fulton Street Elevated Lines.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) At the intersection of Court and Fulton Streets, showing Brooklyn City Hall (now Borough Hall) and the park. At the left (building with the dome) is the court house on Joralemon Street.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Montague Street, south side, west from Fulton Street*. At the extreme left, is the Continental Insurance Building, next to it the Old Academy of Music, next to it the Academy of Design. The trolley tracks are no longer on Montague Street. The clock on the right, was still keeping time in (1936). This whole block has been renovated.

About 1890.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Fulton Street ("El" thereon), south from its intersection with Court Street, past Joralemon Street, showing the Brooklyn Borough Hall (right) facing a small park. Note the absence of the clock tower atop the Borough Hall; it was destroyed by fire.

About 1900

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(2)

The Borough Hall, many years later. The clock tower has been restored.

1936

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project

Fulton Street ("El" thereon), south from its intersection with Court Street, past Joralemon Street, showing the Brooklyn Borough Hall (right) facing a small park. Note the absence of the clock tower atop the Borough Hall; it was destroyed by fire.

About 1900

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(2)

The Borough Hall, many years later. The clock tower has been restored.

1936

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project

Montague Street, north side, at and west of Court Street. Note the dress of the policemen.
1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Montague Street, south side, west from Court Street, showing a rear view of the Academy of Music, opened in 1861 at a cost of over $200,000. It was destroyed by fire in 1903. At the right, is the steeple of the Church of the Holy Trinity. In the background is the Pierrepont Hotel.
1902.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Fulton Street, west side, near Myrtle Avenue. Shown are two views of the cupola of Brooklyn's Borough Hall, as rebuilt after the fire of 1858.

1920's
Views 1, 2

Fulton Street, west side, near Myrtle Avenue. Shown are two views of the cupola of Brooklyn's Borough Hall, as rebuilt after the fire of 1858.

1920's
Views 1, 2

Court Street, west side, from Montague (right) to Remsen Streets. On the extreme right is the Mechanics Bank Building at the northwest corner of Court and Montague Streets. To the left of it, at the S.W. corner of the two streets, is the Continental Insurance Building (narrow building) and the Phoenix Insurance Building. These two were torn down in 1926 and the 35-story Montague-Court Building erected on the site. The clear-ance to the left of the Phoenix Building, which is the northwest corner of Court and Remsen Streets, is the former site of the Garfield Building, where the 29-story Court-Remsen Building was later put up. The view is across Borough Hall Park from Fulton Street. The statue (center left) is that of Henry Ward Beecher, distinguished preacher of the Plymouth Church and abolitionist.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
1925

Court Street, south from the intersection of Fulton and Court Streets. Also shown at the left, is Fulton Street, south from and including Court, to and including Joralemon Streets. In the foreground, is shown the Borough Hall Station of the B. M. T. and I. R. T. Subway Lines. In the background, is shown the Borough Hall Building.

December 1925.

Brown Brothers.

Fulton Street, west side, from Myrtle Ave., to Joralemon Street, as seen from Borough Hall Park. In the center is the Fulton Street Elevated line.

April 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Montague Street, north side, west from Court Street. At 197 is seen The Montague Street branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. The building was erected in 1867.

December 1925.

Brown Brothers.

A general view west from the Temple Bar Building located at the S.W. corner of Court and Montague Streets, showing the Brooklyn Heights section of Brooklyn between Remsen Street (extreme left) and Fulton Street (extreme rights). In the foreground is the Episcopal Church of the Holy Trinity at the N.W. corner of Montague and Clinton Streets. At the left background is the Hotel Bossert at the S.E. corner of Montague and Hicks Streets. Also shown is the Manhattan skyline and at the right a part of the Brooklyn Bridge. Note the junction of the East and North Rivers with Upper New York Bay. The New Jersey skyline vaguely appears in the left background.

1926.
Brown Brothers.

16-26 Court Street, west side, between Montague and Remsen Streets, showing in the foreground, Borough Hall Park, and at the left part of the Borough Hall Building.

May 1926.

Brown Brothers.

Court Street, south from and including Montague Street. In the foreground is the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated line. In the background is seen the Borough Hall Building, with its tower and clock; in back thereof is shown the new Municipal Building.

1928.

Hall

Fulton Street, south from, but not including Myrtle Ave., to and including Joralemon Street. On the left is shown the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated Lines. On the right, in the extreme background, on Joralemon Street, is seen the Kings County Supreme Court Building. On the right on the street level, is the Court Street Station of the Fourth Ave., B.M.T. Subway Line. 1928.
Hall-Photo.

Washington Street, at the N.E. corner of Myrtle Ave, showing the Crystal Theatre, at 327 Washington Street, at the left background.

About 1928.

Empire Photographers.

Neg #
# 1817 (8 x 10 Neg)

(1)
Washington Street, west side, north from Myrtle Ave., showing the Standard Union Building in the foreground, and the Hotel Clarendon north of it. This entire area has been razed in 1935, to make way for a park and new approach to the Brooklyn Bridge.

June 2, 1931.

P.L. Sperr

(2)
The same, showing a closer view of the Standard Union Building.

April 13, 1931.

P.L. Sperr

(3)
The same, showing a closer view of the Hotel Clarendon.

June 2, 1931.

P.L. Sperr

Court Street, east side, just south of the intersection of Fulton and Court Streets. A view of Borough Hall Park, and Borough Hall Building.

1933.

Ewing Galloway.

A general view southeastward from No. 53 Clark Street, the Hotel St. George. On the right is the Court-Montague Building (taller one) and the Court-Remsen Building. To the left of these (white structure) is the Brooklyn Edison Company Building; in the far distance is the Williamsburg Savings Bank Building. The U-shaped, white building (left) is the United States Post Office and to its right, the dark building with the cupola, is the Brooklyn Eagle Building.

view 1: June 15, 1933

P. L. Sperr

View v is north from the Hotel St. George and shows the Plymouth Church, on Orange Street, in the foreground. On the left is Hicks Street.
title: General view - [Brooklyn.]

title: General view - [Brooklyn.]

text:
Court Street, south from, but not including Montague Street, showing a view of Borough Hall.
June 6, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Fulton Street (elevated structure thereon), west side, at Myrtle Avenue (foreground), showing prominently the Mechanics Bank Bldg. The partially seen building at the left is the Montague Court Building.

September 7, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

Fulton Street (right), west side, at Myrtle Avenue. The old 3-story building is at the southeast corner of the intersection and the clearance at the northeast corner. The Fulton Street "EL" is on the right and in the background is the dome of the Borough Hall.

P. L. Sperr
September 7, 1938

Brooklyn Academy of Music.
Montague St., s.s., betw. Court and Clinton Sts. This view is looking e. fr. Clinton.
P.L. Sperr collection
Rec'd January 13, 1945

Brooklyn Academy of Music.
Montague Street, s.s., betw. Court and Clinton Sts. This view is looking west fr. Court St.

P. L. Sperr collection.
Received Sept. 12, 1945.
